attributes.action: Make electricity/gas/water smart meter data app and API for domestic consumers.
attributes.additional_details:
Real-time access to smart meter data on a phone app would tell us which activities use the most electricity, gas and water. This would help us cut electricity, gas and water use - saving money and helping to save the planet.

Apps and platforms such as Home Assistant can provide more intelligence to consumers than a stand-alone smart meter display. They can illustrate history, trends and spikes and tie the data in with other sources such as solar panel generation and variable tariff prices.
attributes.background:
Make a free app for consumers to look at their real-time energy and water usage on their phones.

Make an API available so that platforms such as Home Assistant can integrate this data.

Allow users to authenticate with the MPAN plus a recent meter reading / date of reading.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how customers can access data from smart meters are a matter for individual utility companies, not the UK Government or Parliament.
